message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.LG. 

The paper discusses techniques for spreading information effectively through influential users in social networks, which falls under the category of social network analysis. The paper also mentions the use of algorithms and optimization problems, which suggests a focus on computer science. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.SOC (Computational Social Science). 

The paper also mentions the use of linear influence models and parallelization, which suggests a focus on data science and machine learning. This makes cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) likely sub-categories as well. Finally, the paper discusses the effectiveness of their methods, which suggests a focus on evaluation and performance, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) a possible sub-category as well.
